resources.string: Choissisez un fichier valid, s'il vous plaît
Extension de fichier n'est pas valable
Extension de fichier n'est pas valable, essayez .gz

Capture d'écran Paramètres d'écran Gameboy Palette Montrer le taux de trame Charger ROM Réinitialiser Aide À propos Enregistrer Vers haute filename Remplacer Oui Non Entrez un nom de fichier Auccun Rom chargé. États d'enrigestrement peuvent seulement être chargés pour un rom spécifique et il sont deposés dans un dossier nomé après le rom: "rin/sav.{nom du rom}" Erreur: Ce chemin d'enregistrement n'existe pas. Cross button Touche A Touche B Touche Select Touche Start Prévisualisation de la palette Quand la palette personnalisable est sélecté, appuyez sur la carré de la couleur pour la changer. Prévisualisation de la couleur Monochrome Sépia brillant Rouge Sépia sombre Couleur pastel Orange Jaune Bleue vif Bleue foncé Gris Vert clair Vert foncé Inverse Palette personnalisable pour un Rom spécifique Palette personnalisable globale Paramêtres d'écran Voisin-le-plus-proche: Le plus rapide, mais sans d'interpolation Réseau-bilinear: Recommandé - Vite et interpole les marges des pixels. Bilinéaire: Lente et floue mais interpolation bilinéare pour tous les pixels Vitesse Valeur par défaut Copier les roms automatiquement dans le dossier rin Enregistrement automatique L'intervall du temps en seconds entre les enregistrements automatuques. Entrez 0 pour désactiver.

Rin pour android


This application is subject to the GPLv2 and later license. Thanks to homer for the gb emulation core, davexx for the rewind code, yukutu for the colorpicker, octal for his gameboy icon, the linux kernel, bionic, lodepng, google for android and so on. Source code availaible at https://github.com/kdevkdev/rin. Parts of the big icon (the gameboy notably) are under this license.

Help


Folders: Put roms under /sdcard/rin (or "external-storage-directory"/rin)

Zip- Support: Zipped and GZipped Roms are supported. Note: For Zip- files, there needs to be a file in the zip with the ending .gb, .gbc or .sgb in the root folder. Sram and states are gzipped.

States: Are used to save the game progress, respectively to load it again. To load a state, first load the corresponding rom and then the state. States are saved into rin/save/sav.{"rom-name"}

Autocopy Roms: If enabled, roms are copied to /sdcard/rin (or "external-storage"/rin).

Sticky Keys: When dragging the finger out of a touch-key zone instead of releasing it, the key remains pressed. To realease it press it again normally.

Rewind: Hold the back key pressed to rewind

Config: Local config means rom specific, global config is for the whole app. The global palette, the autocopy rom, the framerate marker and the scale method are the only global settings. All other settings are local.

Screenshots: Are saved to rin/save/sav.{"rom-Name"}. Donate: Your appreciation would be greatly appreciated

Help


This is the filebrowser. Browse to any place where supported filetypes are stored. If you see a empty list this means there are no supported filetypes in this folder. Click "Up" to go a directory level up. Directories are colored turquoise and files are colored white

Help


This is the filebrowser to save files. Browse to the folder where you want to store the file. Then enter a name in the textfield and hit save. Up goes a directory level up. Files are colored white and folders turqouise.

No Roms

No supported files in the initial directory (sdcard/rin or "external-storage"/rin). In order to play, a rom must be provided (with file ending .gb, .gbc or .sgb or a zip file containing one of these files). Its recommended to put them in this folder, however it is possible to browse the contents of the filesystem of your device (hit "Up" to go a directory level up) and load a rom from some other folder, or open a supported file with this application (not recommended).

This application does not provide Gameboy executables (called roms) nor any facility to download them for legal and other reasons. It is technically still illegal to download roms for example via a google search, altough it is considered as a tolerated practice, since no new gameboy roms are sold anymore. Capture d'écran faite
